When using imperative languages, we, the programmers, often care about the performance. And the performances differ even if we acquire the same result. While declarative language only describe the desired results, so the performance is optimized by the engine, not the programmers.
Another advantage of declarative languages is that it is much easier for them to be executed parallely.
